Instruction: Whisk eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer until well blended.
Whisk together sugar, eggs, and salt in a saucepan. Pour in the milk and cook over medium-low heat. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens, about 10-15 minutes.
Strain the mixture through a cheesecloth-lined colander to form a ball of cheese. Tie the cheesecloth tightly around the ball and hang it over a bowl for about 3 hours to drain the whey.
Wrap the cheesecloth ball in plastic wrap after untying it, then refrigerate. The cheese can be stored for up to a week. Slice and enjoy.
